description:
**Fix Overview**:

To address the Windows storage elevation of privilege vulnerability (CVE-2024-43551), the following updates must be applied:

1. Identify the Windows version and corresponding build number of your system.
2. Download and install the necessary updates as outlined below:
   - For Windows 11 Version 24H2: KB5044284 from [Microsoft Update Catalog](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044284)
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2: KB5044285 from [Microsoft Update Catalog](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044285)
   - For Windows 11 Version 22H2: KB5044280 from [Microsoft Update Catalog](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044280)
   - For Windows 11 Version 21H2: KB5044280 from [Microsoft Update Catalog](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044280)
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2: KB5044273 from [Microsoft Update Catalog](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044273)
   - For Windows 10 Version 21H2: KB5044273 from [Microsoft Update Catalog](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044273)

**Details**:
This series of updates resolves the improper link resolution before file access which can result in an elevation of privilege. Ensure the installation is performed on supported builds: Windows 11 Version 24H2 (10.0.26100.2033), 23H2 (10.0.22631.4317), 22H2 (10.0.22621.4317), and 21H2 (10.0.22000.3260), as well as the relevant Windows 10 versions. Backup important data before proceeding with any updates to prevent data loss.
